tool.name: ODV
tool.description: interactive plotting tool for geo-referenced data
tool.command:
export HOME=\$PWD && mkdir -p Documents/ODV/.temp/ && mkdir -p Documents/ODV/data/outputs && chmod 777 Documents/ODV/ -R && #if $method.type == 'own_data' : #for $infile in $method.infiles: yes | cp '$infile' './Documents/ODV/galaxy/data/$infile.display_name' && #end for #end if #if $method.type == 'zip' : #import re
#set zip_file_path = $method.folder #set source_folder_name = re.sub('[^\s\w\-]', '_', str($zip_file_path))
unzip "$zip_file_path" -d './Documents/ODV/galaxy/data/$source_folder_name' && #end if /init ; mv ./Documents/ODV/data/outputs/ ./output && rm ./Documents -rf

param.name: type
param.label: Select if you are using a ODV collection in a zip folder or if you have your own raw data
param.option: The data you are using are a ODV collection in a zip folder
The data you are using are Netcdf or tabular text files

param.name: infiles
param.label: Netcdf or tabular text file. For text file, odv format is recommanded.

param.name: folder
param.label: ODV collection in a zip folder.
param.help: Must contain the specific folder structure with file.odv and folder.Data

tool.help: `ODV <https://odv.awi.de/>`_ plots geo-referenced and other arrays from netCDF, HDF, GRIB, and other datasets. For now, Galaxy is supporting only netCDF and text files as odv text file as input.
